alert.note: Alert for Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 07 at 9:38PM MST until January 08 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 7 inches. Wind gusts of 35 to 55 mph, with higher gusts possible in northern Lincoln county. * WHERE...Castle Rock, and Limon. * WHEN...Until 2 PM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Roads will likely become slick and hazardous. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Travel may become very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning commute.
info.instruction: Persons should consider delaying travel if possible. If you must travel, keep a winter storm kit along with you, including items such as a flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.
